intro: Abarema pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered acacia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Its seeds are enclosed in slender, hairy pods and are often dispersed by wind. Abarema pauciflora is adapted to various habitats, including dry forests and savannas, and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
